title: Learner Autonomy Empowerment Strategies in [Large-Scale] AI-Driven Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and online learning experience
context.additional_context: Social sector practical competency development program using AI tools in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can self-directly design learning pathways in AI-based simulation environments.

Using VR collaboration tools (e.g., ENGAGE, AltspaceVR), learners can perform a 30-minute knowledge co-construction activity with three peers on one social issue solution, propose and record feedback at least twice during the process, and submit final outputs (text/audio notes).
Learners can engage in critical thinking about digital divide awareness and the ethical implications of AI systems.

resources: License for Mobile-Optimized AI Learning Platform
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
